marklogic.body: The AL pays big money for big name sluggers but I still think the NL is better. The Tigers, Angels, Rangers, Red Sox, Yankees, and the Rays are all powerhouses of the AL but every other team does not seem up to snuff. The NL is more balanced and has more contending teams. Those 6 AL teams I mentioned above are realistically the only teams that will compete for playoff Spots. In the NL, you have the divisional frontrunners like the Phillies, Cardinals, and Diamondbacks but the Giants, Rockies, Dodgers, Reds, Brewers, Marlins, Nationals, and Braves are all arguably in the mix as well. That's 11 contending teams in the NL as opposed to 6 in the AL.
